title: Marion, Ala., Remembers Death That Sparked 1965 Selma Marches
teaser: The Selma-to-Montgomery marches might not have happened if not for the death of Jimmie Lee Jackson a few weeks before in Marion, Ala. NPR returned to Marion as people remembered Jackson and how his death was a catalyst for many other civil rights events in 1965.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
